Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.nanoservice

Class NanoServiceFactory

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.nanoservice.NanoServiceFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExecutionControl, NanoService, com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class NanoServiceFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, NanoService, com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler

This class is an embedded light-weight WEB server to use in the Java applications. Ordinal, but not the only, use case for it is to support web-styled help system for your application.

The most important features of the class are:

  • support all the six HTLP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEADER and OPTIONS)
  • support static content based on FileSystemInterface functionality
  • support of embedded Creole/HTML converter to use Creole content for your "site" directly
  • support light-weight RESTFul-styled services for your "site"
  • support https connections
  • support loopback functionality to check your "site" requests

This class functionality is based on the HttpServer. Web-server can be started, stopper, paused and resumed. With conjunction to NanoServiceManager it can make hot deployment of your RESTful services. To increase performance, every class deployed wraps with compiled stub (see AsmWriter) and doesn't use reflections on service calls in many cases

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.3
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
HttpServer, Creole
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

    • deploy

      public void deploy​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.Object instance2deploy) throws java.io.IOException, ContentException, SyntaxException
      Description copied from interface: NanoService

      Deploy processing class to the given path of Nano service. Class must be annotated with annotations were mentioned above

      Specified by:
      deploy in interface NanoService
      Parameters:
      path - path to deploy processing class to
      instance2deploy - pluggable singleton instance to process all requests for the given path and all subpaths
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - on any I/O errors
      ContentException - on any errors in the class
      SyntaxException - on any errors in the class annotations

    • undeploy

      public java.lang.Object undeploy​(java.lang.String path) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: NanoService

      Undeploy processing class from the given path of Nano service

      Specified by:
      undeploy in interface NanoService
      Parameters:
      path - path to undeploy processing class from
      Returns:
      pluggable singleton instance was deployed earlier of null
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - on any I/O errors
